firstSession: ^Today, we'll work on understanding ADHD and building your skills to manage it.
^Let's start by understanding what ADHD is.
^ADHD stands for Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder.
^It’s a neurodevelopmental disorder that affects both children and adults.
diagnosis: ^Can you tell me about some challenges you've faced that make you suspect you might have ADHD?
focusIssues: ^Having difficulty focusing on tasks is a common symptom of ADHD.
^It can manifest as trouble staying on task, easily getting distracted,
^Can you give me an example of a situation where you struggled with focus?
focusAtWorkOrSchool: ^Many people with ADHD find it challenging to stay focused at work or school.
^This can lead to incomplete assignments or missed deadlines.
^Have you tried any strategies to help with this?
focusAtHome: ^Difficulty focusing at home can make it hard to complete household chores or personal projects.
^Have you tried any strategies to help with this?
focusInSocialSituations: ^Struggling to focus in social situations can affect your ability
^to engage in conversations or remember details.
^Have you tried any strategies to help with this?
impulsivityIssues: ^It might show up as speaking out of turn, making hasty decisions,
^Can you tell me about a time when impulsivity caused you problems?
impulsivityAtWorkOrSchool: ^Impulsivity at work or school can lead to interrupting others,
^Have you tried any strategies to help with this?
impulsivityAtHome: ^At home, impulsivity can affect relationships with family
^or roommates by causing conflicts or misunderstandings.
^Have you tried any strategies to help with this?
impulsivityInSocialSituations: ^In social situations, impulsivity can lead to difficulties in conversations,
^such as interrupting others or sharing inappropriate comments.
^Have you tried any strategies to help with this?
hyperactivityIssues: ^or finding it hard to sit still.
^It’s more noticeable in children but can persist into adulthood.
^How does hyperactivity affect your daily life?
difficultySittingStill: ^Finding it difficult to sit still can impact your ability to
^focus and participate in activities that require prolonged sitting.
^Have you tried any strategies to help with this?
constantFidgeting: ^Constant fidgeting can be distracting for you and others,
^making it hard to concentrate on tasks.
^Have you tried any strategies to help with this?
feelingRestless: ^Feeling restless can make it challenging to relax and unwind,
^Have you tried any strategies to help with this?
forgetfulnessIssues: ^It can mean misplacing things, forgetting appointments,
^or having difficulty following through on tasks.
^Can you give me an example of a time when forgetfulness caused you problems?
forgetfulnessAtWorkOrSchool: ^Forgetfulness at work or school can lead to missed deadlines,
^lost items, or difficulty keeping track of assignments.
^Have you tried any strategies to help with this?
forgetfulnessAtHome: ^At home, forgetfulness can cause issues like misplacing items,
^forgetting important dates, or neglecting household tasks.
^Have you tried any strategies to help with this?
forgetfulnessInSocialSituations: ^In social situations, forgetfulness can lead to missing appointments,
^forgetting names, or not remembering details from conversations.
^Have you tried any strategies to help with this?
strategiesDidNotWork: ^It's common for strategies to not work the first time.
^ADHD management often requires a combination of approaches tailored to your unique needs.
^Would you like to continue discussing your symptoms?
noStrategiesTried: ^There are many strategies we can explore together to help manage ADHD symptoms.
^Would you like to learn about some of these strategies now?
otherIssues: ^ADHD symptoms can vary widely. It's not just about hyperactivity;
^it can also include emotional regulation issues,
^Can you tell me more about the challenges you’re facing?
emotionalRegulationIssues: ^Emotional regulation issues can mean difficulty managing emotions,
^experiencing intense feelings, or having mood swings.
^Have you tried any strategies to help with this?
timeManagementDifficulties: ^poor planning, or trouble estimating how long tasks will take.
^Have you tried any strategies to help with this?
otherSpecificIssues: ^Tell me more about the specific challenges you're facing with ADHD.
otherDetailedChallenges: ^Understanding the unique ways ADHD affects you can help us
^Let's work on identifying effective coping mechanisms together.
selfAwareness: ^Since you feel that the symptoms you have informed me about lead me
^to believe you have ADHD, one immediate skill I can teach you is developing again
^Developing self-awareness involves understanding your strengths, weaknesses, and patterns of behavior.
^By becoming more self-aware, you can recognize ADHD symptoms and triggers, empowering you to
^implement effective coping strategies and manage your symptoms more effectively.
^Would you like to continue learning new skills in the next session?
exitFirstSession: ^Come back when you're ready to learn more.
subsequentSession: ^Today, we can work on building more skills to manage ADHD.
^What do you want to focus on?
socialSkills: ^Improving your social skills can help you navigate social situations with greater ease.
^By learning how to communicate effectively and read social cues, you can manage ADHD-related
mindfulness: ^Mindfulness techniques can assist you in staying present and focused, reducing the impact of
^distractions commonly associated with ADHD. By practicing mindfulness, you can cultivate greater
^awareness of your thoughts and emotions, allowing you to better regulate your attention.
stressManagement: ^Learning stress management techniques can help you mitigate the impact of stress on your ADHD symptoms.
^By identifying stressors and implementing coping mechanisms such as relaxation exercises and time management
^strategies, you can reduce overwhelm and maintain focus even in demanding situations.
exit: ^Thank you for the session today. Remember to practice what you've learned!
repeatPrompt: ^Do you want to learn about another skill?
